name: Ensure you don't have hard-coded credentials in your source code because it could be retro-engineered by attackers.
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Javascript)
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Typescript)
Ensure you don't compare passwords against hard-coded strings in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (C#)
Ensure not relying on the session ID provided by "request.getRequestedSessionId()"
Ensure you are not using "referer" header field in HTTP request
Always set an expiration time for an Http Session to improve security
Ensure invalidating HTTP Session during logout to avoid broken Authentication
Ensure specifying "PermitAll" or "user role" for URL(s) access to enforce security
Ensure explicitly specifying single HTTP method in @RequestMapping methods to avoid information leakage
Ensure you have not disable AntiForgery token in Razor Pages (ASP.NET MVC)
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path (C#)
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie domain (C#)
Ensure you set the time out to less than 5 min or less.
Ensure retaining the settings of aspnet:UseLegacyFormsAuthenticationTicketCompatibility to True.
